methodology: Web search validation of filtered novel predictions

key_discoveries.evidence: RCT with 81 patients showed prolongation of overall survival and PFS when added to thalidomide/dex (TDL vs TD). Higher apoptosis rates (p<0.001). Safe and well tolerated.
key_discoveries.actionability: HIGH - Could be added to myeloma treatment protocols

key_discoveries.evidence: Not FDA-approved for MS but widely used off-label. WHO listed as essential medicine for MS (July 2023). Phase II trials (HERMES, OLYMPUS) demonstrated efficacy. Much cheaper than ocrelizumab ($2-14K vs $75K/year).
key_discoveries.actionability: HIGH - Already in clinical use, advocacy for formal approval ongoing

research_supported.evidence: Preclinical evidence shows cardioprotective effects via sGC activation and cGMP signaling. Improved LV contractility in rat heart transplant model. No dedicated human HF clinical trials identified.
Multi-kinase inhibitor shows promise for TNBC based on mechanism. Currently approved only for CML/ALL. Significant cardiovascular toxicity limits clinical use.
research_supported.actionability: LOW - Toxicity concerns, no breast cancer trials completed

false_positives.reason: No significant influence on glucose levels in diabetics. Cardiovascular risk concerns.
Phase III trials with IGF-1R inhibitors FAILED in breast cancer. No effect on tumor growth in vivo for TNBC.
Large-scale clinical trials showed disappointing results. No significant association with breast cancer risk.
Never tested for MS. All clinical trials were in oncology (ovarian, renal cancer).
Mechanism valid but drug WITHDRAWN from US market in 2007 due to cardiac valve regurgitation risk.
No evidence for asthma. Experimental anti-cancer drug studied for diabetic kidney disease. ERAs used for pulmonary arterial hypertension, not asthma.

recommendations.action: Add Lovastatin to myeloma adjunct therapy consideration
Document rituximab off-label use for MS
recommendations.evidence_level: WHO Essential Medicine + Phase II trials

recommendations.action: Investigate gemfibrozil for heart failure in clinical trial
Update ground truth with FDA-approved drugs identified as 'novel'

filter_improvements_needed: Add more withdrawn drugs to exclusion list
Add drugs with failed Phase III for specific indications
